words.definition: To advocate a plan or idea is to support or suggest it in public.
words.example: The group advocated increased spending on education and schools.

words.definition: To authorize something means to give permission for it.
words.example: The mayor authorized the construction of a new statue in the park.

words.definition: A civilian is someone who is not in the military.
words.example: It was Todd’s job to keep civilians from entering the army facility.

words.definition: A commodity is something that can be bought or sold.
words.example: Fran’s uncle made most of his money trading commodities.

words.definition: A conquest is an event by which one country takes over another.
words.example: The conquest of the Aztecs by the Spanish changed history.

words.definition: To disclose something means to make it known to others.
words.example: The company disclosed the details of the new project.

words.definition: Dynamics are the ways in which things or people behave and react to each other.
words.example: The dynamics of the group changed when a new member joined.

words.definition: To enroll means to officially join a school, group, or class.
words.example: I decided to enroll in a Spanish class this semester.

words.definition: When someone is envious, they want something that someone else has.
words.example: She was envious of her friend’s new car.

words.definition: Euphoria is a feeling of extreme happiness.
words.example: The winning team was in a state of euphoria after the game.

words.definition: If something is festive, it is bright and cheerful for a celebration.
words.example: The house looked very festive with all the decorations.

words.definition: When someone is jolly, they are cheerful and happy.
words.example: The jolly old man told funny stories to the children.

words.definition: A lentil is a small, round seed like a bean used for food.
words.example: She made a delicious soup with lentils and vegetables.

words.definition: A marshal is a high-ranking officer in the military or police.
words.example: The marshal led the parade through the city streets.

words.definition: Morale is the amount of confidence and enthusiasm a person or group has.
words.example: The team’s morale was high after their victory.

words.definition: A prophecy is a prediction about what will happen in the future.
words.example: The old woman’s prophecy came true many years later.

words.definition: A sage is someone who is very wise.
words.example: The young man sought advice from the village sage.

words.definition: A senate is a part of the government that makes laws.
words.example: The new law was passed by the senate after a long debate.

words.definition: A sentiment is an opinion or feeling about something.
words.example: The speaker expressed a sentiment of hope for the future.

words.definition: Unrest is a state of anger or dissatisfaction among a group of people.
words.example: The high taxes caused civil unrest in the country.
